item.title: From Zero to DNS Hero; My Journey Setting Up a Blog with a Custom Domain
item.author: axelvanherle@outlook.com (Axel Vanherle)
item.description: For a while now, I have been interested in setting up my own website or, at the very least, learning how to do so. Setting up a blog seemed like a good way to achieve this goal. To me, normally, setting up a website involves getting an old Optiplex computer, installing Linux on it, and serving my page with a web server like Caddy or Nginx. Doing this results in getting a boring old IPV4 address, but I always wanted a cool custom domain name, because who wants to go to a random IPv4 address?
